reviews.review: I am conflicted. wish it were different, but i love these movies in general hard to give 4 stars
Could have been a good movie but the ending SUCKED!!!!
Worth the wait!!   the cast did a excellent job playing their characters. fight scenes were PHENOMENAL.
i am upset with the abrupt ending and killing off of many loved characters.

The first Marvel movie I saw in the theaters was Captain America: Civil War - a friend kept bugging me to see Ant-Man on DVD (bugging me ...) and it hooked me to the point that I went back and saw each movie from the first Two Phases (Iron Man to Avengers: Age of Ultron).   
Once caught up, it was time to start finding out as much as I could about each of the Avengers and Guardians of the Galaxy, as well as each villain associated with the groups, including The Infinity Gauntlet and Infinity War comic series.
As the Infinity War movie grew closer, my anticipation and speculation grew and grew.  Even though it was only 4 years, it seemed like an eternity.
Words cannot express how thoroughly my expectations were met and exceeded.
From the moment that the Marvel logo appeared without the normal intro music and replaced with the haunting plea from the Asgardian ship to halt fire from Thanos and the Black Order, it was apparent this was something special.  
Every action sequence, every meeting of Avenger and Guardian was pitch perfect in tone, humor and magnitude.  Very little seemed forced.  Barbs being traded between Iron Man and Doctor Strange; Thor and Star Lord and Captain America and Groot were memorable, remarkable, yet realistic.  
The star of the movie for me was the antagonist, Thanos.  For someone that wanted to wipe out half of the universe, he seemed to have a certain respect and understanding for those that opposed him.  Not to mention the fact that the movie did not follow the comic book Thanos' reasoning for obtaining the Gauntlet and Infinity Stones.
Between each death, reveal and in some cases return, coupled with the humor, it seemed almost impossible that more than 2 and 1/2 hours went by between that haunting opening and the pager being dropped in the after-credits scene.
The roller coaster of emotions that the movie bought on put it in a class of entertainment that could only be compared to sporting events for me: I felt drained walking out of the theater after the first viewing.
Even on subsequent viewings, even knowing what is going to happen and when, I am still amazed, angry and amused with what happened.
Is it May 3, 2019 yet?

This was one epic movie that will give you all the action sequences that fans come to see. It isnâ€™t the best comic book film out there, but is definitely worth seeing for its action and twist ending.

Half a movie and they still wasted over 2 and a half hours of your time. No complete character arcs, no tension, no memorable action scenes, and the humor was barely alive. Marvel made their first DC film.

Absolutely Amazing movie. Very big MCU fan and I waited years for this movie to hit theaters and I was blown away. This is the best MCU movie you will ever see, without a doubt. Starts off fast and with a bang! Gets right to the point and held my attention for the whole movie. Very good ending, definitely in need of a second part. The best part of this movie was Thanos (The villain), Josh Brolin is a GENIUS and played him perfectly. At some points in the movie (personal opinion) you even felt sorry for him and that's what makes him an amazing villain and probably the best villain to date.

Not sure where to begin with reviewing this juggernaut of a movie.  Easily the best MCU movie.  Every character had their moment, screen time, and laughs.  The ending... wow.  It's gonna suck waiting to see what happens next.... Best part of the movie: BRING ME THANOS!!!!!
